snippet: Distributing religious books in Germany, a frequent practice of Scientologists and Hare Krishnas, is not illegal, but officials are worried about who is doing the distributing.
abstract: Drive by a fundamentalist Muslim group to give a copy of the Koran to every German, Swiss and Austrian household has tapped into the widespread anti-Islamic feeling in Germany and created an uproar among politicians and security officials; while campaign, started by Salafist preacher Ibrahim Abou-Nagie, is not illegal, officials fear it is a cover to recruit radicals.

byline.original: By MELISSA EDDY and NICHOLAS KULISH

lead_paragraph: Distributing religious books in Germany, a frequent practice of Scientologists and Hare Krishnas, is not illegal, but officials are worried about who is doing the distributing.

headline.main: Koran Giveaway in Germany Has Some Officials Worried
headline.print_headline: Koran Giveaway in Germany Has Some Officials Worried
